result.execSummary:
The defendant Takia L Brewer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Remaining bail applied of $285.00. Remaining balance to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 11/01/2016; alternate 24 days jail.
BAIL APPLIED. DNA PAID IN FULL
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Takia L Brewer in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the count 2. Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine: $1524.00
DNA Surcharge $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply any bail that is posted.
Defendant to pay $25.00 a month commencing 11/01/2016  or alternate of 24 days jail
